A rare and formidable blend of pure adamantine with other metals, this alloy boasts the legendary durability of adamantine while incorporating additional qualities depending on its composition. Favored by master artisans and spellcasters alike, this alloy is used to craft weapons and armor that strike a perfect balance between raw strength and specialized capabilities, making every piece both a masterpiece and a practical marvel.

A sleek, polished metal blend predominantly composed of silver, with traces of other metals to increase its durability and conductivity. This alloy shines with a soft, silvery luminosity that almost seems to shimmer with a faint internal glow.

This broad-mouthed, brass-cast firearm resembles a short, wide tube with a flared barrel designed to unleash a spray of projectiles. When fired, the blunderbuss emits a thunderous blast, scattering shrapnel in a cone that covers a wide area at close range. Its intimidating appearance and loud report make it both a practical and fearsome firearm.

Ever wonder what happens if you mash a battle axe and a blunderbuss together? Well, here’s your answer. The Axehead Blunderbuss is a ridiculous firearm that looks like a savage barbarians’s dream—and possibly a nightmare for anyone caught in its spray.

A sleek, elegant firearm that marks a significant leap forward in personal weaponry, the flintlock features a smooth barrel and intricate woodwork. Its distinctive ignition system relies on a flint striking steel to produce sparks, igniting the powder charge and sending a lead ball hurtling towards its target. Known for its reliability across firearms, the flintlock became a symbol of technological progress and tactical advantage.

Forged in the bustling workshops of Gond and masterfully engineered for rapid fire, the Gondian Double Flintlock is a marvel of craftsmanship—and an absolute showstopper. This double-barreled masterpiece resembles twin sleek black guns, seamlessly mounted side by side, ready to unleash a storm of lead in quick succession. When fired, both barrels discharge simultaneously or in quick sequence, flooding the area with deadly projectiles and chaos. Its design allows an expert marksman to deliver devastating volleys.

This crudely assembled blunderbuss appears to have been fashioned from scrap metal and warped wood, held together with mismatched parts and rough craftsmanship. When fired, the firearm emits a loud, irregular bang, often accompanied by smokepowder. Its scattershot can spray unpredictably—sometimes hitting enemies, other times missing entirely.

Steam constantly hisses from vents along the body. When fired, pressurized steam and mechanically driven pistons propel a lead ball with remarkable force and precision, often accompanied by a burst of scalding vapor. The steam musket’s roaring report echoes like a thunderclap, and its fiery burst can ignite combustible materials. This weapon embodies a perfect fusion of steam-powered engineering and firearm mastery, making it a formidable addition to Dictators arsenal.

This heavy, ornate firearm features a long barrel carved with intricate patterns and a finely crafted flintlock ignition system. When fired, it unleashes a devastating bolt of lead. Its smoke-belching shot can turn the tide of combat, providing a dramatic and powerful alternative to traditional bows and crossbows.

Journal Entry of Droo Thrain

Date: 1492 DR

Today, I set out from the forge at dawn, bound for Last Light Inn. Rumors tell I can easily find trader there with materials I’ve yet to acquire for my next firearm. It’s a journey through treacherous woods, but the promise of unique components drives me forward. I hope the innkeeper can provide shelter and perhaps a bit of news from the Baldur's Gate.

Once I’ve gathered what I need, I will continue to Baldur's Gate to the Forge of the Nine. Their master smiths are said to craft the finest enchanted alloys, perfect for my greatest firearm. I must ensure I don’t miss my chance; their supplies are rare and highly sought after.

May the flame guide my path, and the anvils await the clang of my hammer.
